name: Cardiff City FC History Multiple Choice Quiz | Cardiff City | 10 Questions

questions.text: What year were the club formed?
questions.explanation:
1899.

	The club moved into Ninian Park 10 years later.

questions.text: Who was the club's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
Davy McDougall.

	McDougall managed the club from 1910-11, followed by Stewart for 22 years until 1933. Wilson was next for a short spell, with Jones taking the helm from 1934-37.

questions.text: Who did Cardiff City beat in the 1927 FA Cup final?
questions.explanation:
Arsenal.

	Cardiff became the first non English team to lift the cup, when they beat Arsenal 1-0 at Wembley Stadium.

questions.text: Which of these players scored the most goals in a season for Cardiff?
questions.explanation:
Robert Earnshaw.

	Richards hit the net 30 times in the 1946-47 Division Three (South) season. This was beaten by 2002-3 by Robert Earnshaw (35 goals)

questions.text: From which club did Cardiff sign Spencer Prior in 2001?
questions.explanation:
Manchester City.

	Prior began his career with Southend in 1989, and moved onto Norwich in 1993, where he stayed for a further three years, before signing for Leicester for two seasons. In 1998, he moved to Derby County, then onto Manchester City in 2000, until signing for Cardiff in June 2001.

questions.text: The club set a record for their highest attendance at a match in 1953, but who was it against?
questions.explanation:
Arsenal.

	57,893 crammed into Ninian Park on 22nd April, 1953 and went on to finish a 0-0 draw between the two teams.

The Bluebirds.

	Other nicknames the club have had are 'The Carfiffians', 'The Citizens', and 'The City', although they adopted 'The Bluebirds' as their official nickname during the early 20th century.

questions.text: In what season did Cardiff first become runners-up in Division One?
questions.explanation:
1923-24.

	Huddersfield Town beat Cardiff into second place that year on goal average. Both teams finished the season with 57 points, but Huddersfield had 1.82 average, while Cardiff were just behind with 1.79 average.

questions.text: What season saw Cardiff win their first divisional title?
questions.explanation:
1946-47.

	Cardiff won the Division Three (South) title in 1946-47 with 66 points, 9 clear of second placed Queens Park Rangers.

questions.text: Brian Clark scored a very famous goal in Cardiff's history in the 1971 European Cup-Winners Cup quarter final first leg. Who was it against?
questions.explanation:
Real Madrid.

	City won the first leg game 1-0 at Ninian Park, but in the return leg, Real Madrid won 2-0 and went through 2-1 on aggregate.
